lines.content: Used ChatGPT to draft V-themed greeting/exit lines. Manually integrated and tested.
Observation: Faster copy tweaks; kept logic simple to meet minimal spec.
Enhanced V with echo functionality using clean code practices:
- Refactored code into logical methods (showLogo, greet, echo, farewell)
- Added Javadoc comments for all methods
- Implemented main input loop with 'bye' condition
- Added proper error handling and resource management
- Maintained V's theatrical personality in all output
Added task management with V's dramatic style:
- Implemented String[] tasks array with MAX_TASKS limit (100)
- Added task counter and management methods
- Implemented 'list' command to show all tasks
- Added dramatic responses for all operations
- Included divider lines for better output formatting
- Handled edge cases (empty list, max tasks reached)
AI Usage: Used AI to help structure the task management system and generate V's dramatic responses. Manually implemented all logic and verified behavior.
Refactored to use Task class and added mark/unmark functionality:
- Created Task class with description and isDone state
- Implemented mark() and unmark() methods with V's dramatic flair
- Added input validation for task numbers
- Updated list display to show task status ([X] or [ ])
- Maintained V's theatrical voice in all responses
- Improved error handling for invalid inputs
AI Usage: Used AI to help design the Task class and generate V's dramatic responses for the mark/unmark functionality. Manually implemented the core logic and verified behavior.
Implemented task types (Todo, Deadline, Event) with inheritance:
- Created abstract Task class with common functionality
- Extended Task with Todo, Deadline, and Event subclasses
- Added support for new commands: todo, deadline, event
- Implemented proper parsing for task descriptions and dates/times
- Enhanced list display to show task types and additional details
- Maintained V's theatrical style in all responses
- Added input validation and error handling for all commands
AI Usage: Used AI to help design the class hierarchy and generate V's dramatic responses. Manually implemented the command parsing and task management logic.
Refactored to use ArrayList for dynamic task management:
- Added input validation and error handling for all commands
- Maintained V's theatrical style in all responses
Implemented enums for better code organization and type safety:
- Implemented `TaskStatus` enum for task state management
- Refactored command parsing to use enums
- Improved code maintainability and type safety
- Added comprehensive error handling for invalid commands
- Maintained V's theatrical personality in all responses
- Updated all task operations to use ArrayList methods
- Added proper error handling for empty lists
- Improved task counting with proper pluralization
AI Usage: Used AI to help design the enum structure and generate V's dramatic responses. Manually implemented the enum logic and integrated it with the existing codebase.
Added delete functionality and improved user experience:
- Added proper task renumbering after deletion
- Enhanced error handling for invalid task numbers
- Updated help text to include delete command
- Improved output formatting for better readability
- Added confirmation messages for task deletion
- Maintained V's dramatic personality in all responses
AI Usage: Used AI to help design the delete functionality and generate V's dramatic responses. Manually implemented the core logic and verified behavior.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
2. Put it in an empty folder.
3. Open a terminal in that folder.
To build the runnable JAR yourself:
// 👇 set to your real entry point
// Let the app read from the console when running via `gradlew run`
// lock to Java 17 as required by CS2103T
* V - A personal assistant with a theatrical flair, inspired by V for Vendetta.
* This program greets the user, manages tasks, and bids them farewell.
* Constructor for V. Initializes the UI, storage, and loads tasks from storage.
* Runs the V CLI application loop.
* Reads commands from {@code Ui}, parses them into {@code Command}s, and executes them
* until an exit command is issued.
* Main entry point of the V CLI application.
* Orchestrates parsing, execution, and persistence of tasks.
* Command to add a new deadline task.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* Executes this command by creating a new {@code Deadline} and adding it to the list,
* @param tasks   the task list to update
* @param ui      the UI to display feedback
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command to add a new event task.
* @param description The description of the event
* @param from The start time of the event
* @param to The end time of the event
public AddEventCommand(String description, String from, String to) {
* Executes this command by creating a new {@code Event} and adding it to the list,
* then persisting the updated task list.
* @param ui      the UI to display feedback
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
Task newTask = new Event(description, from, to);
* Command to add a new todo task.
* @param description The description of the todo task
* Executes this command by creating a new {@code Todo} and adding it to the list.
* Also persists the updated task list using {@code Storage}.
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate
* @param ui      the UI to display messages
* @param storage the storage to persist changes
* @return false to indicate the application should continue running
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* @return true if the command should exit, false otherwise
public abstract boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Returns whether the command is an exit command.
* @return true if the command is an exit command, false otherwise
* @param index The index of the task to delete
* Executes this command by removing the task at the given index,
* displaying feedback, and persisting the updated list.
* @param tasks   the task list to update
* @param ui      the UI to display feedback
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("     Very well. I've removed this task from the records:");
System.out.println("     Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task" + (tasks.size() != 1 ? "s" : "") + " in the list.");
ui.showError("No such task exists. The number must be between 1 and " + tasks.size());
* Executes the exit command by showing a goodbye message.
* @param ui      the UI to display the farewell
* @return true to indicate the application should exit
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this command should terminate the application.
* Command to find tasks containing a keyword (case-insensitive).
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} that searches for tasks with descriptions
* @param keyword the search term to match within task descriptions
* Executes this command by filtering tasks in {@code TaskList} that contain the keyword
* @param tasks   the current list of tasks
* @param ui      the UI used to display results
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Executes this command by displaying all tasks in the list.
* @param tasks   the task list to display
* @param ui      the UI to render the list
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command to mark a task as done.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done
* Executes this command by marking the task at the given index as done,
* displaying feedback, and persisting the updated list.
* @param tasks   the task list containing the task to mark
* @param ui      the UI to display feedback to the user
* @param storage the storage used to persist the updated task list
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("     A tick for triumph. Marked as done:");
ui.showError("An error occurred while marking the task as done.");
* Command to mark a task as not done.
* @param index The index of the task to unmark
* Executes this command by marking the task at the given index as not done,
* displaying feedback, and persisting the updated list.
* @param tasks   the task list containing the target task
* @param ui      the UI to display feedback to the user
* @param storage the storage used to persist the updated task list
* @return false to continue running the program
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("     Undone, for now. Marked as not done:");
ui.showError("An error occurred while unmarking the task.");
* Represents the types of commands that can be executed by V.
* Each command type is associated with its string representation.
* Returns the command string associated with this command type.
* Converts a string to the corresponding CommandType enum value.
* @return the corresponding CommandType, or null if no match is found
* Represents the status of a task.
* A task can be either done or not done.
* Returns the icon representing this status.
* @return the status icon ("X" for done, " " for not done)
* @return DONE if current status is NOT_DONE, and vice versa
* Represents the type of a task.
* Each task type has a corresponding tag used in string representation.
* Returns the single-character tag for this task type.
* @return the task type tag ("T" for Todo, "D" for Deadline, "E" for Event)
* Parses user input into commands for the application.

private static final String ERROR_INVALID_DATE_FORMAT = "Please use the format: yyyy-MM-dd for dates.";
private static final String EMPTY_INPUT = "Even silence speaks volumes. But I need words to understand you.";

* A task that needs to be done before a specific date/time.

* V - A personal assistant with a theatrical flair, inspired by V for Vendetta.
* This program greets the user, manages tasks, and bids them farewell.

assertTrue(Parser.parse("event project meeting /from Mon 2pm /to 4pm") instanceof AddEventCommand);

assertEquals("X", t.getStatusIcon(), "After mark, status icon should be X");
assertEquals(" ", t.getStatusIcon(), "After unmark, status should be blank again");
assertTrue(t.toString().startsWith("[T][ ]"), "String should reflect not done again");

assertEquals(" ", t.getStatusIcon(), "New task should not be done");

assertEquals(" ", t.getStatusIcon(), "After unmark, status should be blank again");
assertTrue(t.toString().startsWith("[T][ ]"), "String should reflect not done again");
